steps.desc: Connect the breadboard assembly to the underside of the base
Push the two motor drivers onto the mounting posts
Clip the two wheels assemblies onto the base and                     connect the motor leads to the the motor drivers
Connect the jumper wires between the motor drivers and the Arduino
Clip the piezo sounder into place
Push the caster assembly into the base so that it snaps into place
Push the shell down onto the base and twist to lock into place
Push the Arduino onto the breadboard - make sure you position it correctly,                  as it's a tight fit with the Robot base!

Push the wheel onto the motor shaft 
**Optional:** add a rubber band to wheel for extra grip.
Insert the marble into the printed housing

children.markdown:
## Introduction

The LogoBot build is broken down into sub-assemblies that can be worked on sequentially by one person, or in parallel if there is more than one person building.

All the diagrams can be viewed in OpenSCAD allowing real time zooming, rotating and panning to get the best view.

### General Build Tips

* X if left/right, Y is backwards/forwards, Z is up.down

### Tools Required

* Screwdriver ?

children.desc: Push the Arduino onto the breadboard - make sure you position it correctly,                  as it's a tight fit with the Robot base!
Connect the breadboard assembly to the underside of the base
Push the two motor drivers onto the mounting posts

Push the wheel onto the motor shaft 
**Optional:** add a rubber band to wheel for extra grip.

Push the wheel onto the motor shaft 
**Optional:** add a rubber band to wheel for extra grip.
Clip the two wheels assemblies onto the base and                     connect the motor leads to the the motor drivers
Connect the jumper wires between the motor drivers and the Arduino
Clip the piezo sounder into place
Insert the marble into the printed housing
Push the caster assembly into the base so that it snaps into place
Push the shell down onto the base and twist to lock into place
